title: Relates to protecting minors from exposure to obscene materials
summary: Increases the age at which young persons may be legally exposed to obscene materials by raising the legal age at which young persons may be legally exposed to obscene materials from eighteen to twenty-one years of age; prohibits retailers from employing persons under twenty-one years of age to participate in the sale of obscene materials; imposes a civil penalty of not more than one hundred dollars per violation.

       AN ACT to amend the penal law and the general business law, in  relation
         to increasing protection for minors from exposure to obscene materials

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 235.20 of the penal law, as  added
    2  by chapter 791 of the laws of 1967, is amended to read as follows:
    3    1.    "Minor"  means any person less than [seventeen] TWENTY-ONE years
    4  old.
    5    S 2. The general business law is amended by adding a new article 29-JJ
    6  to read as follows:
    7                                 ARTICLE 29-JJ
    8                    EMPLOYEE EXPOSURE TO OBSCENE MATERIAL
    9  SECTION 613. DEFINITIONS.
   10          614. RETAIL SALE OF OBSCENE MATERIALS AND EMPLOYEE PROTECTION.
   11    S 613. DEFINITIONS.  AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL
   12  HAVE THE FOLLOWING MEANINGS:
   13    1. "OBSCENE." ANY MATERIAL IS "OBSCENE" IF  (A)  THE  AVERAGE  PERSON,
   14  APPLYING  CONTEMPORARY  COMMUNITY STANDARDS, WOULD FIND THAT, CONSIDERED
   15  AS A WHOLE, ITS PREDOMINANT APPEAL IS TO THE PRURIENT INTEREST  IN  SEX,
   16  AND  (B)  IT DEPICTS OR DESCRIBES IN A PATENTLY OFFENSIVE MANNER, ACTUAL
   17  OR SIMULATED: SEXUAL INTERCOURSE, SODOMY, SEXUAL  BESTIALITY,  MASTURBA-
   18  TION,  SADISM,  MASOCHISM, EXCRETION OR LEWD EXHIBITION OF THE GENITALS,
   19  AND (C) CONSIDERED AS A WHOLE,  IT  LACKS  SERIOUS  LITERARY,  ARTISTIC,
   20  POLITICAL, AND SCIENTIFIC VALUE. PREDOMINANT APPEAL SHALL BE JUDGED WITH
   21  REFERENCE TO ORDINARY ADULTS UNLESS IT APPEARS FROM THE CHARACTER OF THE
   22  MATERIAL  OR  THE  CIRCUMSTANCES OF ITS DISSEMINATION TO BE DESIGNED FOR
   23  CHILDREN OR OTHER SPECIALLY SUSCEPTIBLE AUDIENCE.
   24    2. "MINOR" MEANS ANY PERSON LESS THAN TWENTY-ONE YEARS OLD.

    1    3. "MATERIALS" MEANS ANYTHING TANGIBLE WHICH IS CAPABLE OF BEING  USED
    2  OR  ADAPTED  TO  AROUSE INTEREST, WHETHER THROUGH THE MEDIUM OF READING,
    3  OBSERVATION, SOUND OR IN ANY OTHER MANNER.
    4    S  614.  RETAIL SALE OF OBSCENE MATERIALS AND EMPLOYEE PROTECTION.  1.
    5  NO PERSON, INDIVIDUAL, PARTNERSHIP, CORPORATION,  ASSOCIATION  OR  OTHER
    6  LEGAL  ENTITY  SHALL EMPLOY ANY MINOR TO PARTICIPATE IN THE RETAIL SALE,
    7  MAILING, DELIVERY, TRANSFER, DISTRIBUTION,  CIRCULATION,  DISSEMINATION,
    8  PRESENTATION, EXHIBITION OR ADVERTISEMENT OF ANY OBSCENE MATERIALS.
    9    2.  A VIOLATION OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION SHALL BE PUNISHABLE
   10  BY A CIVIL PENALTY OF NOT MORE THAN ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS PER VIOLATION.
   11    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   12  it shall have become a law.
